metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3204 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The Go SSH library (x/crypto/ssh) by default does not verify host keys, facilitating man-in-the-middle attacks. Default behavior changed in commit e4e2799 to require explicitly registering a hostkey verification mechanism.

notes.Note: jdstrand> ubuntu-snappy and snapd contain embedded copies of golang-go.crypto tyhicks> snapd doesn't use this particular part of golang-go.crypto as it doesn't act as a SSH client

criterions.comment: golang-go.crypto: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
snapd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
